37878165.review:
This is one of those games that belongs in a category I'd classify as "The one huge exception" because, for the most part, I've never cared for shmups. Too many of them have an extremely tiny margin of error allowed before you get a game over, especially if you wanna go for the SUPER SECRET FINAL BOSS kinda stuff, and the communities are generally full of people who make fun of you for playing on the easier difficulties, so that puts me off even more. REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR is an entirely different story.

This game, on top of having different firing types, a regenerating method of destroying bullets, and a health system that lets you take a number of hits, it also has the most unique mechanic I've ever seen in a shmup, and that's camera rotation. You'd think camera rotation would be the last thing to mention in a game, but this actually makes it the center of the game's concept, where turning the camera is closer to turning a dial to adjust the playing field to your preference, because the bullets exist on a 3D plane, while you exist on a 2D plane.

This means that, on top of being able to tank a couple hits, you're also able to just turn the camera when there's a screen-wide attack, and just go around it. And the camera rotation doesn't end its usefulness there. There are enemies and items to shoot in the background to clear your path, give you health and laser items, and even just increase your score. This game gives you so many great options for keeping yourself in the game, while tying it into a mechanic that you have to master, so even if it makes the experience as a whole easier, it's still a challenge in itself.

Even if you don't care for shmups, I'd still reccommend this game, because it's really just that good, and there's a chance you'll find something to love here. Final note, that SOUNDTRACK GOD DAMN!!! A+

33575926.review:
Revolver 360 Re:Actor possui uma identidade visual atípica. As cores vibrantes são um dos grandes destaques, além de um estilo conceitual que dificilmente não cativa a atenção do usuário em instantes.
Entretanto, a poluição visual exacerbada, causada pela grande variedade de projéteis na tela, é um efeito colateral inevitável que o próprio estilo do jogo traz. Esse efeito é ainda maximizado pelas cores fortes, o que realmente pode atrapalhar durante o gameplay.
A dificuldade também é uma vantagem. O jogo oferece um bom nível de desafio. Nesse gênero, a dificuldade é capaz de proporcionar uma ótima sensação de gratificação depois de passar por uma fase aparentemente impossível.
No geral, Revolver 360 Re:Actor é um game focado em oferecer dificuldade ao usuário, mas que não exclui os jogadores mais casuais para os níveis menos “hardcore” – uma ótima opção para quem gostam de um retrô com uma nova roupagem.
Prós:Gráficos muito bons Ótimo nível de dificuldade
Contras:Tela poluída demais em certas situações

30830434.review:
首先说明..这不是弹幕系STG
作为一款横版STG射击游戏,它的难度属于非常硬核的那个一个级别..
如果你觉得他只是一款平常的弹幕STG,那你就错了..我不推荐你买这个游戏..
接下来简单说下玩法...
这个游戏的特色是滚动版面来闯关.
通过上下滚动,可以将同时站在上面,和下面的敌人滚到一列,然后用激光一发收掉
第二,可以躲避蓝色的无法用激光消除的弹幕,游戏中经常会出现无法躲避的满屏蓝弹,需要通过滚动屏幕躲开,将扩散开来的子弹变成一条直线,和将上下两边的敌人变成成一排同理.
第三,寻找地图以外的敌人.左边有一个指示器会提醒你敌人的方位.游戏有时会出现警报声,这时你需要立刻翻滚找到目标,使用近距离自动锁定攻击将敌人消灭.
虽然你的血很厚,但是初见依旧会死得很快.在2dSTG中,属于难度非常硬核的类型.
玩着玩着你会感觉这其实是一款异次元STG23333

新手可以选择先打挑战模式,前面基本上都是教你系统的.

再次强调,这不是传统的2d横版STG.你面对2DSTG的传统观念都需要改变.3D关卡配置和2D关卡配置融合的非常巧妙.你可能需要很多次练习才能通关.

敌弹速:极快
背板性:很多
系统:复杂(什么时候将敌人滚动到一排,什么时候滚动躲避蓝弹,警报时寻找敌人,从三次元打向二次元的激光,EMP,长按EMP,激光,混合的关卡,四面八方快速袭来的敌人,打得我直喊妈妈..
难度:极高

建议:STG核心玩家,比如GRADIUS玩家,大流士玩家等强烈推荐购买.只玩过东方的不建议购买,以上.

30499099.review:
SHMUPOMETER Rating
EXCELLENT for Hardcore Shmup Fans | Good for Casual Shmup Fans

[h1]REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR is a short and intense side scrolling shmups focused on the ability to rotate the world around your ship with alot of mechanics to keep track of. These mechanics provide both ways to deal with threats and challenges to increase your score dramatically. The difficulty can be rough for someplayers, but the game is short enough (1-2 hrs) where a challenged player just might be able to beat it. The value comes in seeking alternate paths and increasing your score, though this won't be enough "Dollar Per Hour" for many people. The color choice may be a bit harsh for some people, but will be tolerable for many people. [/h1]

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Great Soundtrack, included in the game files
-Unique rotation mechanic, allowing the player to dodge otherwise unavoidable bullet patterns, elimnate background threats, and find secrets
- Laser weapon that destroys enemy Yellow bullets and rows of enemies, but has limited shots, drops your multiplier, and has a cooldown to reload
- EMP shot to destroy blue bullets/lasers and purple bullets which are even more limited than the laser, but also has a reload cooldown
- Same EMP Cooldown Meter governs the use of Overdrive mode, if full, which allows temporarily unlimited lasers and maximum score multiplier and can be used relatively frequently per level
- Relatively forgiving health system, allowing you to take many hits compared to most Bullet Hells, and inculdes health pick ups, and limited regen
- Ways to deal with difficult bullet patterns
- Stable 60fps+ gameplay
- Great port - includes support for XInput and DirectInput - I switch the input mode on my controller AND THE GAME RESTARTED ITSELF SO I DIDN'T HAVE TO
- Helpful how to play page that explains the game numerous mechanics and strategies
- Global leaderboard which includes player replays - allowing players to learn how others played
- Lovely graphics that clearly distinguish threats
-Short. Only 4 stages, meaning it can be completed quickly for somebody wanting to get through their backlog or learn the game easily to run for a better score
- Sector mode - allowing a player to practice a specific level
- Challenge mode - 50 Extra levels that are very challenging and further explain combat and score mechanics
- Inexpensive

[b]Cons:[/b]
- One life, zero continues - If you die, you have to start the whole game over
- Nearly impossible to avoid damage? While most well-crafted bullet hell games are built so that a trained player can take no damage, it seems like you will almost inevitably take damage at some point. Even the #1 ranked player took damage.
- Relatively difficult despite forgiving health system - I've lost runs many times on Sector 2, but eventually I beat it and the rest of the game on the next run.
- Potentially overwhelming gameplay. While you're dealing with an onslaught of enemies, bullets, and lasers, you will sometimes have to deal with background damage dealers if you're not paying attention and rotating the world frequently
- Rotation mechanic may be seen as an annoying gimmick to some players
- Possibly too complex gameplay for some players - Enemy Survival, along with multiple weapon cooldowns
- Stylized UI can get lost lost in the game's art style and hectic gameplay.
- High Price per hour - $10 will seem expensive to somebody only playing to beat the game which can take less than an hour or two. (dependent on player skill - a single run takes less than half an hour)
- Bright, color burn effect may be harsh on the eyes of some players 


Gameplay takes place on a 2D-plane like most shooters. Shooting not only shoots standard bullets, but shoots homing missiles to the 3D background within a short range of your ship - requiring you to "hover" over enemies, environmental threats, and supply boxes to destroy them, or over parts of a boss to deal extra damage. Rotating the ship (or rather, rotating the game world) with the trigger buttons alows the player to more easily dodge some project tiles and deal with background threats or supply boxes that can provide health, weapon restore, or multipliers. You will need to balance this mechanic, along with the weapons I described in the "Pros" section to succeed. I was very concerned I wouldn't be able to beat this game because of a tough portion on Sector 2, but I got past it and found it was short work, meaning that memorizing enemy patterns might be a lass daunting task compared to shooters 2 or three times as long.

[b]REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR will drive away or annoy some players with it's art style and "brain metling" use of rotation and bright colors, but it is a delightul shmup that will certainly entertain and endear many others. I heartily recommend this for shmup fans and it is certainly worth a wishlist/sale for those that play shumps infrequently.[/b]

29458495.review:
自认为手残而无力通关的弹幕游戏2333目前最高纪录只打到过第三关。

这是一款从玩法上讲特别新颖的STG游戏。满屏幕让人眼花缭乱的弹幕自然少不了，同时又可以通过调整摄像机角度来改变弹幕所在的2维平面角度来规避弹幕。武器种类是固定的，大致上分为常规弹（对背景和同一直线上的敌人）/激光（消除黄色弹幕）/震荡弹（消除大型蓝色弹幕），以及清屏用的Bomb。

在第一次看这个游戏的宣传片的时候，被背景上的画面深深地吸引住了，自己本身特别喜欢这种偏科幻风的游戏，对于作者在这个游戏中的场景设计简直佩服得五体投地！

对于360°旋转的这个游戏特色，从标题上就能够得知了2333在实际游戏中，不断旋转视角来改变弹幕平面这个设计简直好到没话说。曾经玩过3d场景的东方同人游戏，在那时候就在考虑如何能够设计出能够在3d场景运用的弹幕射击，不过固定摄像机的视角在人物/机体后端/前段并不能带来的很好的游戏体验，玩家在这样一个条件下所观察到的也只有2维的平面而已，敌机的弹幕距离，方向就变成了很不好观察清楚了。在REVOLVER360中，首先主视角定义成横板，玩家操纵的则是纵向的卷轴视角，一方面弹幕距离和大小不会有很大变化，就解决了之前提到的问题。然后在这个基础上，添加了消除弹幕的设定，实际游戏中玩家可以将满屏幕的弹幕横过来看，轻松躲避过版，或者一发Lazer消除拿分。

分歧点的设定也是这个游戏与众不同的一个地方，简单的说分歧点就是场景路线的选择。分歧点多数为两个，最多有3个，在这个时候屏幕上会出现几个箭头，往箭头所在的方向靠近就会进入不同的的场景，这也为游戏多了不少可探索的要素在里面。

还有一点是在撸boss的时候发现的。如今市面上关卡的设计大多是从一个场景的最外围一直打到内部，最后在一个封闭的场景撸boss。而在这个游戏中出现了类似角逐的场景。第二关boss是一个类似火车的载具，从一开始的boss追玩家和玩家齐头并进到boss残血第二形态玩家追boss。这样的设计让我觉得很棒，像以往，看到太多的类似“玩家清版到boss关，然后boss就一直在一个固定的位置等着玩家来找它”这样一个固定的套路，偶尔有像REVOLVER360这样一个特殊的boss追逐的关卡也挺不错的，即使这个追逐是事先安排好的也好。

由于我大部分时间是在看录像2333（online Rank上提供玩家replay，并记录分数排名，无力自己玩只能膜拜大佬们23333）所以注意到了屏幕左下角那一大片文字，上面会把你吃到的东西，击破敌人得到的分数，打败boss的信息全部写上去2333这也算是一个细节上的特色吧。

总之，如果对STG游戏有信心的话这个游戏是很值得玩一下的。不过还请要注意一下旋转时带来的眩晕问题2333，以及场景有的时候会晃得眼睛疼的问题2333

25558183.review:
Despite the thumbs up I want to make clear that this game is a mixed bag, and I think this game makes it clear that one good idea isn't enough to make a great game.

First, the revolving mechanic, Yes it's cool, dodging bullets, lining up the enemy to wreck them, spotting background enemies. The revolver mechanic really makes the background a massive factor in the game. However, all of the enemies bullets are two dimensional. It's really hard to explain but think of it this way, you see off in the distance an enemy that is shooting a laser out, it looks like it's there to block your path but even though its far off in the background, if you move your ship in front of the laser, you will get hit by it. It can be really disorienting at times.

Second, the ship is boring, you have 3 weapons, your standard shot that shoots directly infront of you, a laser that shoots right in front of you, and an EMP that shoots right in front of you(or clears all bullets on screen if you let it charge) Lasers turn yellow bullets into points, EMP turns anything into Points. But since you can't shoot anywhere but in front of you, you can't hit anything above or behind you. This wouldn't such a problem as long as things didn't attack from behind or above, but they do, a lot. It's just angering since there is almost nothing you can do about those enemies. What would be so wrong with having multiple weapons that shoot somewhere besides infront of you? Oh yes and inorder to hit background enemies you have to get close to them in order to shoot them, so if that thing shoots you from way back in the background it will hit you instantly and you'll be "too close" to dodge.

Third, the arching paths is really a non factor, there is almost no difference between the different paths, I'm not sure why they included it. Do you want the tunnel full of enemies, or the other tunnel full of enemies, it makes almost no difference.

The Graphics are very good for an indie title and the music is great, and the game comes with the sound track. It's well polished and has no bugs as far as I can see, it's not great but it's not bad either and the price they are asking is completely reasonable. An okay game with one cool mechanic, but not much else.

25356679.review:
-7/10-

In overall, REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR is a great game, with solid gameplay and really, really fun to play.
The scoring and camera movement mechanics are really impressive, and construct an interesting game.
The problem I feel by playing is the lack of content. I played for 4/5 hours and I have already got half and more of the achievements, completed the story mode and won half the challenges (which can be really challenging, however).
The final level and boss are almost a joke, since the level has half the lenght of the first one, and the boss is really easy to beat, even if it's not being compared to other bosses as the second level one, which I find to be the more entertaining and difficult.
Graphics are really nice, and go along with the game.

I loved the game, but I feel like I need more to play with. More levels, sometimes more bullets, and a thougher final boss would make this a 9 or 10.
Also, I buyed it on discount, but the full price seems a little too much for the product given.

[EDIT for the steam awards: I think It should win something because its graphical awesomeness and its entertainment value!]

23704936.review:
Отличный shoot em up как минимум с одной фичей - поворачиваться "вокруг своей оси". По началу ощущается как нелепая и ненужная деталь, но вплетена достаточно грамотно и очень сильно помогает в не одной и не в двух игровых ситуациях (хотя и при несвоевременным применением можно себе и больше навредить, хех). 
Помимо этого ещё достаточно крепко задействованы механики разбиения проджектайлов, в зависимости от каждого типа есть три способа их предотвращения. 
Аркадный режим просто наполнен буллетхелловыми ситуациями, почти не прекращающимся на секунду действием и как ни странно, даже вариативностью. В зависимости от выбранного пути можно сделать себе игру, как проще, так и сложнее. И вообще, в плане сложности игра хороша - дает игроку челлендж, но при этом умеренно прощающая. Патовых ситуаций, где от снарядов нельзя спокойно уклониться минимум, да и от одной пули умереть не дадут, благо вместо рудиментарной системы жизней тут имеется более привычная система здоровья. Так что остаётся быть только внимательным.
Также имеется режим секторов, где можно пройти по отдельности интересующий уровень (кроме последнего босса) и челленджи, где всяческие обыгрываются фичи игры.  
Сопровождает всё это безумие одновременно бодрая и медитативная электронная музыка от ZARIGANI, поставляющийся в комплекте с игрой бесплатно. 
Говоря о недостатках можно сказать несколько вещей: а) визуально игра находится на тонком льду от того, чтобы всё на экране не сливалось, но к счастью, несмотря на цветовую палитру, ограниченной в разных оттенках красного, белого и синего, каждую вражескую модельку от заднего плана можно отличить. 
б) Возможно я что-то упустил, но далеко не все снаряды можно выбить с помощью EMP-зарядов. Если в случае ловушек, выпускающие лазер, это ещё понятно, то с боссом во втором уровне происходит несколько непонятное. Когда босс выпускает мины, выпускающие лазеры, то от них остается только уворачиваться, хотя когда этот же босс во второй фазе выпускает такие же мины, то их лазеры можно сбить EMP-полем. Странно. Хорошо, что такой момент в игре только один. 
в) Если вы не любитель выжимать все соки в плане побочных режимов и выбивать очки, то игра в аркадном режиме достаточно короткая. У вас уйдёт, как минимум, пару часов.
REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR - занимательный shmup-опыт, сделанный почти что одним человеком. Он при этом и перенимает все самое лучшее с игр того же жанра с игровых автоматов, и при этом "разбалтывает" своими особенностями. Игра определённо заслуживает внимания.
P.S. Забыл отметить, что игра одновременно подерживает и Xinput, и Directinput, так что большинство аркадных стиков или старых геймпадов не останутся без дела.

23024864.review:
>> This review might be updated later with some extra info <<

DAAAAAAAMN! THIS GAME IS AWESOME!
REVOLVER360 RE:ACTOR is a shoot'em up game; but it has a very interesting difference from other games in this genre: you can rotate the enviroment!
For example, you can use this ability to line up several rows of enemies and destroy them at once or to avoid screen filling attacks. This ability also made the game a lot challenging since the enemies and some goodies are placed around the enviroment. In addition to this ability, you have access to a straight laser attack which can eliminate enemies and some projectiles, and an overdrive move which removes every projectile from the screen.
There are three modes to play in this game. I recommend completing the challenges before playing through Reactor mode to learn the basics.

Positive Points:
- The enviroment rotation mechanic is very innovative and has made the game unique
- Multiple paths in stages
- Nice difficulty (The game is hard at first. But when you get used to the mechanics it becomes easier.)
- Nice visuals and soundtracks (Soundtracks are bundled with the game.)

Negative Points:
- TOO MUCH BLUE COLOUR!

Notes:
- The game can freeze on launch due to one reason: downloading scoreboards. To avoid this, check ((Offline Mode)) in game's config file which is in the game's main directory.
- I haven't finished the game, so it's early to tell the game is short or not. I'll update the review later about this.

　全４ステージとステージ数は少ないが１つのステージが長めなので満足感はある。
　ステージ１から画面の死角から襲う隕石に「なんだこれファック！」と思うだろうが、即死はしないので慣れよう。
　なぜならクリアだけなら、耐久値性の上にライフがあちこちに隠されているのでダメージはそんなに気にすることはないのだ。
　チュートリアルの代わりにチャレンジモードというものが用意されており、ゲームシステムはここで覚えることができる。
　システムさえわかればアドリブで結構行けるので、横シュー苦手な私でもクリアできたぞ！

　ところでこのゲーム、開発途中版のオーバーチャージにバグがあってレーザーがほぼ撃ち放題になるバージョンが一番面白かった。
　そのバグモードを完成版にも入れてくれよ！と頼んだのだが、作者は実装してくれない。ケチである。
　みんなもっとレーザーを撃ちたいだろう？レーザー撃ちまくりたいと声を上げてくれ！
　あとPS4版の開発は（略）

A new twist on the shoot-em-up formula?  GET IT?  This game's gimmick is that you can rotate the level to avoid projectiles, find alternate routes and off screen enemies.  A mechanic that hasn't deeply explored in the genre and was fun to try.

This implementation falls a little short, the rotation can be a bit too dizzying and when combined with the ship direction not matching the scroll direction leads to a hard to digest visuals for the eyes.

The player weapons, enemy patterns and bosses however fell short and ended up being the standard faire seen in this style of game many times before.  Overall the rotation gimmick isn't enough to carry this game to the finish line but it's something more games should consider.

Overview: Shoot em Up


The Good

+ A cool mechanic that allows you to rotate the environment around you allowing you to avoid bullets, obstacles and enemies 

+ Throughout the level you are given a choice in how you want to proceed providing good incentive for replays. 

+ Great difficulty balance. The game appears hard at first but once you get use to the games mechanics the game becomes easier

+ 50 Challenges that will test your limits and patience. 

+ Easy to see what's going on for the majority of the game


The Average

Lots of blue....

Fairly short game, if you are not a fan of the genre you could easily beat the game in 1-2 hours and never play it again. 


Conclusion

Shoot em ups are not my favorite genre. I find them repetitive, however this game is really fun because it doesn't over use the amount of bullets on screen and the rotating mechanic is interesting enough to keep you engaged for a while.

This game is something else!

At first glance it looks like a regular shmup. 

Then you discover that you can turn your camera around the X axis to avoid seemingly unavoidable projectile barrages, instantly, the game is more fun than you expected.

Then you learn that you can actually shoot down the projectiles with your special attacks, all of them, if you align your camera just right. Waiting for the screen to fill with bullets before you kill the enemy is a bad idea, right? Wrong, not in this game, turn your camera and clear the screen in one shot! What is this!? I don't even...

Then you learn that you can do the same thing with multiple enemies, killing  them all in one shot.

Then you learn that you can combine all that and get even higher scores.

THEN YOUR HEAD WILL SPIN!

18443664.review:
I love shoot 'em ups, but I will be the first to admit I am not very good at them.   One of the great things about this game is that it is very approachable for all skill levels.  In fact, I actually cleared this game (there are no continues, so every clear is a 1cc), which is a first for me as I have never cleared a shmup without using a continue (terrible thing to have to admit, I know).  It only took a few practice runs of the 2nd and 3rd stages, and a couple replays that I watched from the leaderboards to achieve this too.  However, there is alot more difficulty and depth in the scoring, plus numerous challenges to satisfy you after you have gotten that first clear.  In addition, each stage has multiple routes, some of which require conditions to unlock, so the stages have alot of replayability.  My favorite way to play this game is just practice one stage, experimenting with different routes and rotating in different areas to shift bullets for better scoring, or to find more items or destructible objects.

From the video and screenshots you can see that the graphics are very unique and original, and quite good too.  The first time you play this game, make sure you try the challenges first.  The beginning ones are what actually teach you to play the game.  

The rotating mechanic is also very original.  It feels like you are actually changing the shape and pattern of the enemy bullets and I think this game is worth playing just for experiencing this neat new system alone.

18178896.review:
The only complaint I have about this game is that sometimes it is a bit difficult on the eyes for me-- but that's just me. You might have a different experience dependent on your color contrast and ideal monitor setup.

That said.

I am by no means an expert, professional shmup player. I love them, I have a passion for them, but I'm not spectacular at them. This game makes me feel like I'm a professional anyway. You will slowly learn the game as you continue practicing it, figuring out ways to make seemingly impossible attacks become trivial. You will watch yourself destroy massive hulking behemoths of nightmarish blue metal and you will feel invincible.

I often watch replays of top players just to watch the backgrounds, just to see the details in the landscapes that I'm otherwise not paying attention to. The optimization is top-notch, and I'll be shocked if the game runs at anything shy of 60FPS the entire time.

This game is absolutely worth full purchase value.

17519573.review:
Revolver 360 is an STG (or "Shmup") that is innovative in its mechanics whilst remaining respectful to the classics and fundamentals of the genre. To summarise, Revolver 360 is a 2.5D STG taking place in 4 stages, with branching paths and bosses at the end of each level. The player shoots enemies and objects coming from all directions in a 3D plane whilst moving within a rotatable cylindrical playing field. Bullets can be rotated-around and cancelled through abilities which use up constantly-recharging resources. The scoring system is based around cancelling bullets and enemy chaining (although the chaining is not nearly as strict as games like Dodonpachi, which is notorious for its perfection-demanding enemy chaining). There are also 50 short challenge levels which test the player's knowledge of the different game mechanics, as well as their memorisation.

As someone who usually plays STGs for survival and tends not to care about getting high scores, the scoring system in Revolver 360 is so addictive that it has gotten me hooked and trying to improve my scores regularly in spite of my preferences for survival play.

The scoring system is based around two multipliers: a first multiplier which is based on chaining enemy destruction, it is capped at X16, although this limit can temporarily be broken through using overdrive mode; the second multiplier is a count of how many bullets you have cancelled. Bullets are cancelled through destroying enemies as they are firing lasers, using your ship's own lasers, or using the emp shot (a powerful charge shot which breaks through blue beams which lasers cannot cancel) and overdrive, which cancels all bullets on screen once activated. Larger enemies fire more bullets at lower health, so the player has to be careful to leave them on as little health as possible to cancel as many bullets as possible. The effect this has on the gameplay is that it encourages players to be constantly taking risks, as it requires them to rotate clouds of bullets directly towards them to cancel them out with a well-timed/positioned laser cancel. The nature of the first multiplier encourages players to mix up their main shot (which works as you would expect from a basic STG shot type) and their laser for the most optimal chaining. This combined with the fact that there are many routes to take throughout the meticulously-crafted and gorgeous levels (there are even secret routes!) means that there is a ton of player freedom and replay value.

[b]Note: video review embedded below.[/b]

Revolver360 is, at a glance, complete and absolute absurdity. Picture a bullet hell shooter drenched in futuristic neon blue which fully rotates at the press of a button, existing in three dimensions as you fly sideways through waves of enemies while trying to keep up with the madness on screen.

The number of systems and mechanics at work at any given time in Revolver is in itself intimidating, which when paired with its genre-typical difficulty level and the added intensity of a third dimension, can feel like borderline excess for the sake of it. But Revolver pulls it all off because underneath the inscrutable exterior there’s a very deep, developed formula at work, all focused around an elaborate shooting and scoring system that is only as invasive as you want it to be.

Different types of shots affect different enemies, various meters are raised by particular stimuli, and multiple paths through levels create even more room for experimentation. Revolver fully commits itself to being as complex and unique as possible within the capabilities of its systems, and while this means it’s likely the least accessible shoot’em’up I’ve played in a very long time, its desire to nurture and expand the boundaries of advanced play feels like a justified trade off.

Revolver expresses this best in its challenge mode, which features 50 quick, extremely focused missions which give you a specific task to complete in a short period of time. To me these felt less like fun bonuses to the main game, but rather a comprehensive tutorial detailing the minutia of Revolver’s intricate mechanics and how best to use them. This is accomplished through the challenges themselves, and also the contextual hint system which drip feeds you information in a way that is much easier to parse given you can immediately apply it to an appropriate situation.

Returning to Revolver’s main stages after completing a number of these, I was surprised just how much more I understood about the game I had already beaten once, and how significantly more capable that had made me where simply reading a manual and playing the game had not. I also began to appreciate all the little things I hadn’t even noticed before, like the finer points of the scoring system or how to best utilize the rotation feature to line up enemies, which further solidified in me the idea that Revolver had fully thought through each of its mechanics and the interplay that develops between them. The more I was able to understand the more I enjoyed playing, and it made me wish that other games would be as thorough in their initiations.

But even if you aren’t interested in getting deep into Revolver’s metagame it’s still a fascinating beast of a bullet hell shooter to play around with. Rotating your ship is an ingenious hook that somehow never manages to feel clumsy or obscure important information (an even more impressive task when put up against Revolver’s brainmelting cyberpunk visual style). 

It’s a “cool” that didn’t need explaining; a “cool” which leaked out of the screen like a kettle getting ready to blow its top and told me that I better get ready. And then the game started and all pretenses of restraint evaporated as Revolver boldly declared that it wasn’t going to settle for being just enough shoot’em’up and neither should you.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dW_Tr5E-yts
[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2015/06/15/revolver360-reactor-review/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

16087506.review:
Reviewing this game without praising the "depth" added by allowing you to rotate along the z axis or lauding that it "adds a whole new dimension" to the classic shmup would do my innate sense of corniness an injustice, so I won't even bother.

I'm a huge fan of the genre, but shoot 'em ups can get stale. When twenty games vie for your attention with the same "new" concept (reversing polarity is a popular one), having something that actually switches things up feels fresh and exciting. I died on the first boss (ouch), but I can't wait to try again tomorrow.

At it's core, this is a 2D shmup. It doesn't have the functionality of the established 3D subgenre so it really does feel like a big change from the side-scrolling or top-down classics that we love... and their many spawn that we don't so much.

15995542.review:
The perfect shoot-m-up that re-invents the classic SHUMP genre!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2cZsVXY-oWM

In this long awaited shooter from action masters Cross Eaglet, enemies are not just right in front of you. They're all around you! Using a unique perspective rotation mechanic, players can bring enemies and items into view, putting the odds in their favor in an otherwise impossible situation.

In Revolver 360 RE:ACTOR, you don't only have your bullets to save you. You're also armed with a powerful laser that pierces through weaker enemies, and a screen-clearing EMP. It's the exact kind of weaponry you're going to need if you hope to survive this harsh and hostile environment. 

Use your weapons in concert with each other to toy with your enemies and reap higher score rewards. Killing your foes quickly is not always the best course of action. - Highly Recommended!

14745563.review:
짧다! 

너무 재미있는데, 너무 짧다. 그래서 더 아쉽다. 

기체의 목숨은 하나 뿐이라 죽으면 그대로 게임오버지만, 기체의 내구도가 있는데다 내구도 20이하로 떨어지면 자동 회복까지 있어서 1시간 정도만 플레이 해보면 익숙해져서 그냥 그대로 엔딩을 볼 수 있다. 스테이지가 한 두어개만 더있었으면 하는게 솔직한 심정. 정말 짧다. 

게임 자체는 탄을 피한다는 느낌보다 특수공격으로 적의 탄막을 지워가는 스타일이다. 하지만 단순히 탄을 지우는게 아니라 화면을 빙글빙글 돌려서 내가 원하는 방향으로 탄막의 방향을 바꾸거나, 의외의 안전지대를 찾거나, 숨겨진 아이템을 찾을 수 있는등. 이 회전 시스템 덕분에 단순히 적의 공격을 피하고, 쏘는거 이상의 전략적인 재미가 있다. 3D 그래픽을 단순히 시각적인 용도로만 사용한게 아니라 게임 디자인에 적극적으로 활용하였다는점이 다른 스크롤형 슈팅 게임에서는 찾아보기 힘들었던 발상이라 꽤나 신선하다. 덕분에 제작진이 정말 화면 구석구석까지 디자인에 쓸 수 밖에 없었겠구나 하는 생각이 절로들기는 하지만 짧다.  

또한 텍스쳐를 거의 사용하지 않은듯한 그래픽은 광원과 연출이 조합되어 매우 센스있게 느껴진다. 번쩍거리는 빛의 향연속에서 일렉트로닉 음악에 취해있다 보면 정말 정신없이 빠져든다. 초고속 열차같이 흘러가는 화면속에서 회전을 하다보면 위아래, 하늘과 땅의 구분이 무의미 해지면서 몽환적인 분위기가 연출된다. 이거 어디서 봤더라? 그렇다. 레이디언트 실버건의 그 느낌이다. 특히 마지막 보스는 딱 그 작품의 오마주 같다. 그렇지만 짧다. 

그럼 이 게임의 정가인 9.99달러를 어떻게 생각해야할까? 사실 극장에서 영화 한편 보려면 이거보다 돈이 더 들어가는 편이기 때문에 1시간 30분 정도 재밌게  즐겼으니 과하게 비싸다는 느낌은 들지 않는다. 개인적으로 슈팅 게임은 한번 엔딩을 보면 몇번이고 플레이하는 성질이 아니라서 그렇지 만약 파고드는 사람이라면 분명 회전 시스템 덕분에 할때마다 새로운 느낌을 받을 수 있을지도 모른다. 짧고 굵은. 리볼버360에게 딱 어울리는 말이다. 추천!

14736067.review: Uno de los mejores horizontales de los últimos años, sin lugar a dudas. Por un lado, nos encontramos con una actualización tremenda en el sistema de juego, es volver a la edad dorada del scoring, de pelear por la puntuación máxima, pero sin abandonar la aventura. Al igual que en G-Darius, podemos escoger ruta dentro de los niveles, y a su vez, sub-rutas nuevas dentro de otras. Cada partida saldrá diferente. Lo mejor es la sublime presentación de los jefes y su ferocidad. Un juego de luces, tecnología y epicidad en los patrones de ataque que hacen de este juego una joya del Shmup. Su baile exótico a lo danmaku se verá compensado por un ágil sistema de rotación, donde podremos ver la situación desde otra perspectiva: Podemos convertir una situación de total indefensión en una totalmente distinta. Girar la cámara nos permitirá transformar rutinas expansivas en meros ataques lineales. Todo depende de nuestra visión. A nivel sonoro, tecno potente y que ambienta perfectamente esta odisea cyberpunk de bellísimo entorno. Este juego está vivo y se ha convertido en un clásico instantáneo para mi. Lo mejor del shmup de toda la vida con esa ansiada actualización: bienvenido, shoot 'em up lateral, a tu nuevo hogar, a la era moderna.

It's a unique and polished ride. Be warned though, the game is not for the lighthearted. 13959472.review:
I have an odd relationship with shmups because I'm not that great at them. I don't always manage to complete all of the highest regarded ones. The best just feel awesome to play, though.

This game has a silly name but the triggers (if on a controller) rotate the screen around the action. This lets you turn a screen full of bullets into a single line and then use a laser to blast the bullets apart for points. It sounds like a gimmick but it's a lot of fun and provides a really interesting challenge and a one of the most fun and unique scoring systems I've seen.

The rotation mechanic is also important because you auto-kill items and enemies that are in the background, which you can only see/target if you are rotated a certain way. There are sections where you have to keep your screen facing "forward" to destroy obstacles in the way, while balancing the need to rotate to survive enemy shots.

I think there may be 4 levels with bosses. I'm not sure because I have only managed to beat the stage 3 boss in the single mission mode. I'm definitely going back though, and I recommend it highly.

13792707.review:
If you like more puzzley STGs like Ikaruga then this is right in your alley. I've gotten to rank 32 in the leaderboards so I feel like I've gotten a good understanding of the mechanics. 

You have 3 types of shot. Normal, Laser, and I guess you could call it destroy. Normal rips up enemies but gives little score, laser shoots through enemies and builds score by giving a chain kill bonus, and destroy shoots through enemy blue/purp attacks and also leaves anything it hits near death. Normal shot is the only one that can hit enemies in the background which shares a different chain bonus from laser. You have limited laser shot that regens. Destroy uses meter that is shared with the overdrive power which when activated rapidly regens your laser as well as buffing your shot damage. 

You can also rotate the map left and right to line up enemies for destroy/laser combos or to avoid shots that would normally hit. It is also crucial to rotate to be able to attack background objects that will give score. 

There are background chests that hold powerups. You don't build up your shot like most STGs from powerups in this one. Instead they hold health, laser reload, or overdrive reload. They spawn the same powerup in the same location everytime so for score its important to know when you should be using your laser/destroy/overload abilities so that you don't waste any powerups. 

It's quite a bit of fun once you get into the mechanics. There is also a challenge mode which helps you understand how to build score and utilitze the mechanics the best. Only minor problem I have is that this game is fairly short and the final boss at least in my opinion was somewhat lackluster. But this is an indie STG which has really amazing mechanics so I can't get too hard on it. 

The brightness (and afaik the lack of ability to turn it down) is another minor problem but you get used to it.

tl;dr if you like ikaruga and can deal with the fact that this is an indie game and thus doesn't have as much production values or as tuned boss fights as some other STGs then you'll be in for a treat.

Short version: game's cheap and it's on par with Ikaruga in terms of both porting and game design. Get it.

Long version: I'm so happy there are more and more Japanese games appearing on Steam. Sure, some of them are shitty dating sims but there are lots of gems still not released on the platform. Playism has been delivering (and translating, I believe) Japanese indie games for a while now through their site. Some of them make their way to Steam and they're always very well ported: there are always proper resolution config, control options and such. Revolver360 looks great, supports up to 4K resolutions (16:10 option is hidden under F10 key but that's a minor thing) and of course runs at 60FPS.

Revolver360 has been praised in shmup circles and rightfully so. It's a great take on the genre with 2D plane you can rotate to avoid bullets or find secrets in the background - see the trailer, it explains the basics pretty well. The game's as hardcore as you can get which is the main draw for me. This wouldn't matter if the mechanics weren't fun, of course, but they surely are. I only wish the game would use more colors as it's blue on blue for the most part but that's a design decision and who am I to teach the devs. The tutorial is hidden somewhat in the challenge mode, be sure to try that before trying to clear the main mode.

This game is gorgeous. It is gorgeous in its gameplay and most definitely in its graphics. 

I have a mediocre laptop, so I'm surprised I could run such a detailed and vibrant game.

You're a small futuristic ship I guess, and you have the standard attacks you'd find in any side-scrolling bullet hell (well, not THAT many bullets, but still) shooter, like a normal dual laser shot, a bigger laser, an EMP, and a freakin' Overdrive that I still don't understand what it does b/c I didn't bother to read the manual (it's in the main menu after you finish configuring, choosing a name, and achieving the first achievement just for buying the game, sweet!). 

basically they let you change bullets into points and increase your multiplier so you can have like billions of points OH BOY

The rotation mechanism is very interesting. What you see on your screen is not always the whole picture. There's enemies in the background, as well as ZOMG HUGE ASTEROIDS AND SPACE JUNK (and other crates that can help your ship but those aren't too frequent). So, how do you destroy these things if you can't see them at present? You rotate thorugh your 360 degree field of view, of course! That way, even though you're looking at your ship and the approaching enemies from the side, you can also blast background objects and enemies away, whether they're above or below you! It's a fascinating concept that really sets this game apart and makes it that much more enjoyable. 

You really should get this game if you enjoy a challenge. It is a challenge, honestly. Not that you'll die all the time, of course. But y'know, you could just have rotated through the 3D space to avoid that humongous helicopter's laser.

Okay, whatever, just get the game already, it's breathtaking! No joke!

12633923.review:
I don't often write reviews, but for this game I thought I'd make an exception.  I happened to see it on the store front and checked out the video - at that point I knew the game was for me!

The game's unique gameplay mechanic is to rotate the world around your ship and this is exploited brilliantly to chain enemies and avoid walls of bullets.  I wouldn't describe the game as bullet hell, but more like a Cave shooter; there are plenty of bullets for sure, but every single one of them is there to be used to increase your multiplier.  Although you only get a single life, the game isn't so punishingly hard that you can't progress a few levels with some practice, but like any good shooter you can choose the risky play styles which could net you much more points at the expense of progress.

Graphically the game has a unique look to it, very reminiscent of the demoscene product "cdak" by Quite and Orange.  On level three things get shaken up a bit which is welcomed at that point.  Musically this game is incredible, covering a wide range of styles but remaining high quality throughout, and the soundtrack is right there in the game folder.

A fantastic game then and one that I'm sure I'll keep replaying not just for the score but for the sheer enjoyment of it.

9/10

It's tough at first, but when you get that perfect angle to vaporize everything on the screen with your awesome lazor it's satisafying as hell.  A must buy if you love shmups.

12627356.review:
Fast, blue, stylish and clean. Ikaruga's wilder, more futuristic cousin I think. That's a good place to start when discussing RE:ACTOR. From Cross Eaglet, this bullet hell shmup takes a simple premise and adds a unique mechanic, instead of polarity, you're dealing with rotation. The field of play can be rotated along a 360 degree axis around your ship. In effect, you're flying through a "cylinder" as opposed to a flat playfield as is often the case, with enemies swirling all around you, and the landscape forming a three dimensional tube that often branches and splits, with numerous junctions appearing that will allow you to choose your route (this offers -immense- replayability as you high score hunt or figure out new routes through various stages). 

As you rotate the field of view, the bullets also rotate, so a near impossible field to navigate suddenly becomes a flat line that's easy to dodge, and all of a sudden the game forces you to think in three dimensions, with objects often coming at you from "depth" as well as from the top, sides, front and back. It would be a bit easy to lose track were it not for the utterly gorgeous aesthetic which keeps things simple and easy to keep track of. Everything is presented in a washed out, futuristic neon blue, clean lines and clear presentation keep the game running at a flawless 60fps no matter what you're doing, with everything maxed out on my rig the game looks nothing short of artistic (Oh god please let there be an occulus rift option down the line).

As is the norm for such japanese bullet hell games, the music is energetic, electronic and upbeat, it maintains a strong pace and a good sense of place, but isn't exactly going to reach the heady heights that Ikaruga managed (but then nothing is ever going to manage the soundscape of Ikaruga, let's be fair). It's good enough though, as is the sound effects, which do the job with satisfying explosions and gun noises, everything sounds correct, which is really all that needs to be said. You don't buy these games for the sound, but it's good to see that Cross Eaglet got everything lined up and the sound presentation is clearly up to spec.

What makes this game stand out is the rotational mechanic, which is nothing short of inspired, it imposes a learning curve, and with an Xbox or PS pad, you'll be wise to map it to the shoulder buttons, but after half an hour of getting used to it, you'll be swooping back and forth like a pro, and the game opens up, once you make it past the opening stage, you'll then find junctions everywhere, and you'll be able to navigate through a gorgeous cityscape. 

It's hard, as any good bullet hell should be, but it's worth every second of your attention, offering visual and gameplay delights as you duck and weave your way through a constant barrage of firepower. Each boss makes full use of the rotation mechanic too, forcing you to quickly improvise and adjust to the constant incoming flak that they toss your way, and within a few goes, rotating will be second nature, you may even look at other bullet hells and feel a little... lacking... when you try to change perspective and find you can't.

At this price, it's an absolute steal as well, for what you are paying for, you're getting one of the best experiences since Ikaruga, if you're a fan of the shmup genre, this is an easy sell, if you're new to the genre, getting this and Ikaruga should be high on your priority list. Both of these games are well worth your attention.

12614942.review: Well fewk me sideways...Just when I thought the genre had gone a bit stale and there were no new ideas coming along, this this pops out of relative obscurity and destroys vast swaiths of the opposition. The central "gimmick" here is that you can rotate the battlefield through 360 degrees to evade bullets and concentrate firepower etc. Whilst this seems like a simple idea, in practice it is one of the most inventful, unique and genuinley challenging shmups I've played for maybe 20 years. Grab it for less than a fiver if you like old skool shooters. If you don't (you should) then buy it anyway.
